intro: Sonerila travancorica, commonly known as the Travancore Sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant is evergreen, with glossy, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely on the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
